p: In terms of abundance, the greenway revealed a typical species-rank abundance curve in which a few species dominated, while a long tail of uncommon species contributed to species richness ( Fig 4). The three most abundant species, which comprised ~50% of plant cover during our sampling window, were three non-native grasses: Bromus inermis L. (smooth brome), Bromus tectorum L. (cheatgrass), and Agropyron cristatum (L.) Gaertn. (crested wheatgrass).
